purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then send this data to remote servers via HTTP requests.
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains in array _tmp_2
Sending system information to external domains
HTTP requests with rejectUnauthorized set to false
analysis: This code collects sensitive system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user details, then sends it to known command-and-control domains. The use of base64 encoding suggests an attempt at obfuscation. The HTTP requests bypass SSL certificate validation, which is a security risk. The hardcoded domain names indicate this is likely malicious code designed to exfiltrate system information.
conclusion: This code exhibits characteristics of malware, specifically information gathering and exfiltration functionality.
